summary: The Department of Defense recorded over 40,000 domestic abuse incidents involving military servicemembers, spouses, or intimate partners from FY 2015-19. Of these, 74% were physical abuse. We testified that DOD and the services have taken steps to prevent and respond to domestic abuse. But we found gaps in key areas such as data collection and reporting, as well as implementation and oversight of response activities...
title: Domestic Abuse: DOD Needs to Enhance Its Prevention, Response, and Oversight
